description:
go.blog: update tags

This makes the articles cross-reference each other better.
In particular, I added the "technical" tag for in-depth technical
posts.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.blog
Current state of new blog visible here: http://blog-test.golang.org/

LGTM

The tags aren't probably how I'd tag stuff, but I trust they're consistent
at least.



On Sun, Jun 2, 2013 at 8:03 PM, <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev1,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go.**blog <https://code.google.com/p/go.blog>
>
>
> Description:
> go.blog: update tags
>
> This makes the articles cross-reference each other better.
> In particular, I added the "technical" tag for in-depth technical
> posts.
>
> Please review this at https://codereview.appspot.**com/9960043/<https://codereview.appspot.com/9960043/>
>
> Affected files:
>   M content/advanced-go-**concurrency-patterns.article
>   M content/building-stathat-with-**go.article

On 5 June 2013 09:57, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:

> The tags aren't probably how I'd tag stuff, but I trust they're consistent
> at least.


I'm happy to accept a different scheme. My goal here was just to nicely
populated the "related articles" sidebar with relevant links.

*** Submitted as https://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=24d790a12718&repo=blog ***

go.blog: update tags

This makes the articles cross-reference each other better.
In particular, I added the "technical" tag for in-depth technical
posts.

R=bradfitz, r
CC=golang-dev
https://codereview.appspot.com/9960043

subject: code review 9960043: go.blog: update tags
